message.content:
cs.DC, cs.Distributed, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.OS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper discusses the design of new consensus protocols and fault-tolerance mechanisms for blockchains on HPC systems, which falls under the scope of distributed and parallel computing. 
2. cs.Distributed: Similar to the above, the paper deals with distributed systems and protocols for blockchains on HPC clusters. 
3. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper may also fall under this category as it discusses the security implications of using blockchains on HPC systems and proposes new mechanisms to compensate for the vulnerabilities of MPI. 
4. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper may also be relevant to this category as it discusses the communication and networking aspects of blockchains on HPC systems. 
5. cs.OS (Operating Systems): The paper may also be relevant to this category as it discusses the implementation of a prototype system for blockchains on HPC clusters, which involves the design and optimization of the underlying operating system.
